intro: Polygala adamsonii, commonly known as the Adamson's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Polygala adamsonii is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
